intro: Phlegmariurus minutifolius, commonly known as the small-leaved clubmoss, is a species of vascular plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is a low-growing, evergreen plant characterized by its delicate, needle-like leaves and a creeping rhizome system. The plant typically forms dense mats on moist, shaded forest floors, often found in temperate regions. Its sporophylls are closely arranged around the strobilus, which produces spores for reproduction. Phlegmariurus minutifolius plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
